text: This is an easily entertaining movie, especially for a family with young kids and adults who want the occasional joke thrown their way.

Extremely creative, with several cleverly-hidden jokes I did not initially pick up on. Hugh Jackman and Ian McKellen are surprisingly well-casted. It has a decently strong narrative, holding together rather well. Overall, a delightful film from Aardman Animations.

Filme fraco, o roteiro é fraco, as cenas são fracas, a história é fraca, o elenco é fraco, e ninguém ajuda a melhorar o filme, os personagens são fracos, e o filme deveria ter cenas bem melhores e relevantes, para fazer o filme ser bom
Absolutely lovely watch with my son over the summer holidays.

I LOVED this movie. Idk what it was but I really liked it. 
I loved the amount of hidden adult humor they added in as well.

Flushed away is amazing!!!!! I don't know why but this movie is so creative and never gets boring! The animation is also pretty good! (Besides the humans) that's the only nitpick I have with this movie but I still its really good!
Wow!!! Flushed away is funny

Although it is not the most perfect out of AardWorks movies, this is some enjoyable movie.
It has adventure with a flush down the drain to a city of London where other rats created home. Roddy & Rita made a hood pair after all, he really did belong in the family of her. I wonder where they go in the future.

And to add with it, there is comedy, such as references to other movies (📀💿 in James home) & Finding Nemo with a goldfish saying "Have You Seen My Dad?", slugs bringing comic relief with their singing. Even our villainous toads have had a comedic part with that one moment "My fly's undone" & his backstory made an impact (Charles chose a rat over him)
Another part to make it funny: when Tabitha arrived home (who I wanted to see the face of) showed the pet her new cat - that was Sid. She would probably realise she really did overfeed him seeing Sid's appearance & he lowkey trashed the home. The reaction.
To say, do we really need rats as pets?

Even the soundtrack hypes me up though
This was a really weird but funny movie.
It had clever moments in it. But really it's just a bunch of chaos, zany characters and themes that have been done better in other movies.

For a movie marketed with toilet humor it is surprisingly engaging and memorable. Flushed away was one of the most influential films in my childhood. I rewatch this film every few years expecting to be disappointed due my more developed brain, however I genuinely enjoy it more each watch. Great writing, Great voice acting, fun sets and memorable moments that are sure to make you chuckle. For a movie marketed with toilet humor its surprisingly engaging and memorable and a must watch especially for the youth.
I love it, really hilarious.
This movie is underrated, this DreamWorks Film needs to be checked out again, it has great characters, great story, great visuals.
I mean it’s not the best but it’s not a bad movie, so if your bored it’s worth a watch! 👍
A funny movie with great comedy! I will admit the characters are a tad annoying, but the humor, the plot, and its creative world. It’s a really fun riot.
This and Captain Underpants are the only time toilet humor has worked
Sucks, unfunny last time me and my sisters watched it was when we wanted to get teleported to when we was little and it just sucks
So cute. I loved this movie when I was small. Gives me back such fond memories of when I was little.
